intro: Thelycrania brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stalked thelycrania, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrubland and grassland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, clustered flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Thelycrania brachypoda is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
